section.title: Creating pages using the page factory
section.para: All pages, even custom ones, can be created using the page factory, Zym_Navigation_Page::factory(). The factory can take an array with options, or a Zend_Config object. Each key in the array/config corresponds to a page option, as seen in the section on Pages. By default, the factory will create a page of type Zym_Navigation_Page_Mvc. If the option uri is given, the page will be of type Zym_Navigation_Page_Uri.
To create a custom page type using the factory, the type option must be specied to contain the class name of the page type.

section.title: Zym_Navigation, a page container
section.para: To be able to create a navigation structure without having a root page to keep all other pages in, there is a class Zym_Navigation that merely functions as a container for pages. It can be constructed enitrely empty, or be given an array or a Zend_Config object with pages to put in the container. Each page in the container can also be an array or a Zend_Config object, or indeed Zym_Navigation_Page instances.
